name: Foreign Movies Quiz / Test | Foreign Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Europa, Europa" was a wonderful movie based on some extraordinary real-life experiences by a young man. What is the backdrop for the movie?
questions.explanation:
World War II.

	This European export documents the true-life experiences of Solomon Perel, a Jew who was forced to run for his life and ended up being embraced by the Nazis (among others). Incredible story.

questions.text: "Z" was a top thriller. Who was the star?
questions.explanation:
Yves Montand.

	Directed by Costa-Gavras, this was a tale of political intrigue and violence. Catchy music. "The Confession" was the next one by Costa-Gavras; it also dealt with political terror tactics.

questions.text: "Indochine" was a pleasant (albeit lengthy) movie. Who was the star?
questions.explanation:
Catherine Deneuve.

	Deneuve - well after "Umbrellas of Cherbourg and "Belle Du Jour" - playing a mother of an adult girl. Nice drama, but a bit on the long side.

questions.text: "Blow Up" was a symbolic effort of sorts that many liked. (I didn't.) Who was the director?
questions.explanation:
Antonioni.

	Michelangelo Antonioni. Existential problems for a crime witness.  It didn't work for me, but others liked it.

questions.text: "Juliet of the Spirits" was a strange movie. Who directed it?
questions.explanation:
Fellini.

	It is often difficult to understand what is going on, why things are happening, etc. (Fellini - that covers it.)

questions.text: "The Last Tango in Paris" received a ton of publicity. Why? It was a thunderously boring movie. Who starred in it?
questions.explanation:
Marlon Brando.

	Directed by Bertolucci, with Maria Schneider. All the fuss about "pornography" - who cares? Stunningly dull.

questions.text: Which movie was NOT directed by Ingmar Bergman?
questions.explanation:
Amarcord.

	That one was Fellini. The other three are perhaps the best known works of the Swedish master of the surreal.

questions.text: Which movie was NOT made by Australian Peter Weir?
questions.explanation:
Breaker Morant.

	Morant was by Bruce Beresford, also an Australian. True story. The others by Weir have various levels of interest.

questions.text: "Two Women" was directed by Vittori De Sica. Who was the star?
questions.explanation:
Sophia Loren.

	An Oscar for Sophia Loren. World War II drama.

questions.text: "The Blue Angel" was an early European classic. Who starred?
questions.explanation:
Marlene Dietrich.

	Dietrich's best known work perhaps and the one that launched her to stardom.
